title: Fact check: Old picture of Rajiv Gandhi falsely linked with Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
As Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit Ayodhya on August 5, 2020, to lay the foundation stone of the Ram Temple, a picture of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi has surfaced on social media with claims that it is from Ram Janmabhoomi poojan dated November 9, 1989.

The caption suggests that Congress has done so much for the country and BJP and the Modi Government are only pretending to support Hindutva and are making fools out of Hindus.

ALSO READ: These pictures of saffron painted buildings are not from…

NewsMobile fact-checked the above post and found it to be false.

On putting the picture through Google Reverse Image Search, we found this picture in a news article in The Statesman dated May 11, 2019. The caption below the picture states that this old black and white picture is from 1989 where Rajiv Gandhi is seen with Soviet devotees from ISCON.

On digging further, we put the keywords ‘Rajiv Gandhi’ ‘Soviet devotees’ ‘ISKCON’ ‘1989’, and found more information about the picture on commons.wikimedia.org that also claims that this picture of Rajiv Gandhi was taken when he met Russian devotees of Hare Krishna in News Delhi in 1989.

Hence, the above information proves that the picture is from New Delhi and not from Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh as claimed in the post.
